binddn.description: The identifier of the application to be used by a simple bind

callback_uri.description: The client is a code and implicit client

clientid.description: The clientid (UUID) of the client application.

clientsecret.description: The secret (UUID) of the client application.

confidential.description: A confidential (or trusted) OAUTH2 client is able to keep its credentials a secret

id.description: The value of the ID field of the client application

id_token_claims.description: A space-separated list of claims. These claims are added to the 'id_token', even if the client does not explicitly request them to be added

initiate_login_uri.description: The URI within the application where a third party login can be started.

is_server2server.description: The client is a code and implicit client

is_sso.description: If set the client application is a Single Sign On application

metadata.description: The metadata of the SAML application, use if metadata_url is not available

metadata_url.description: The URL to retrieve the SAML metadata from

name.description: The name of the created client application

owner.description: The UUID of the group that is owner of the client

scopes.description: The Allowed scopes for the client application. For SSO applications this defaults to `profile`

show_landingpage.description: Displays a landing page immediately after login and before redirecting to the SSO application

subject_format.description: Topicus KeyHub can deliver the subject in three formats: Primary identifier, UPN and username.

technical_administrator.description: The UUID of the group that is technical administrator of the client, default to Owner

type.description: The type of the client application. Possible values: `OAUTH2` (default), `LDAP`, `SAML2`

uuid.description: The UUID of the created client application

script.description: The script defines the body of a `function (account, groups) { <SCRIPT> }` function, and is written in JavaScript using the ECMAScript 5 standard

block.description: The additional attributes which can be retrieved through userinfo

application_administration.description: Group can be assign as managing group of an application

audit_months.description: List of Months the group must be audited. Possible Values: `JANUARY`,`FEBRUARY`,`MARCH`,`APRIL`,`MAY`,`JUNE`,`JULY`,`AUGUST`,`SEPTEMBER`,`OCTOBER`,`NOVEMBER`,`DECEMBER`

auditing_auth_groupuuid.description: The UUID of the group to set as authorizing group for audits

hide_audit_trail.description: Don't show audit trail in KeyHub Dashboard

id.description: The value of the ID field of the group

membership_auth_groupuuid.description: The UUID of the group to set as authorizing group for membership

name.description: The Name field of the group

nested_under_groupuuid.description: The UUID of the group to nest the new group under

provisioning_auth_groupuuid.description: The UUID of the group to set as authorizing group for provisioning

record_trail.description: Require a reason before activating a group

permissions.description: List of permissions to grant the client application. Possible values: `GROUP_FULL_VAULT_ACCESS`, `GROUP_READ_CONTENTS`, `GROUP_SET_AUTHORIZATION`

uuid.description: The UUID of the client application

block.description: Grant clients permissions on the create group, (client used by terraform provider requires global `GROUPS_GRANT_PERMISSIONS_AFTER_CREATE` permission)

rights.description: The rights of the member. Possible values: `MANAGER` (default), `NORMAL`

uuid.description: The uuid of the keyhub account to add as member

block.description: At least one manager or nested_under_groupuuid should be defined

display_name.description: Display name of the group on provisioned system. (Only on systems that support a display name)

id.description: Type of the resulting group in the provisioned system, for example: POSIX_GROUP for ldap.

name_in_system.description: The name in the system, value normally to CN of the DN (of the provisioned system). For example: `cn=umbrella,ou=group,dc=example,dc=com`

owner.description: The UUID of the group that will become owner of the grouponsystem

short_name_in_system.description: common name part of the resulting DN. For example: `cn=umbrella`

system.description: The UUID of the provisioned system to create the group on

type.description: Type of the resulting group in the provisioned system, for example: POSIX_GROUP for ldap.

group.description: The UUID of the group that will become a provisioning group for the grouponsystem

static.description: If set to true the group on system will be static provisioned

block.description: Define the provisioning group for the grouponsystem, can be set multiple times. If omitted the owner group will be the provisioning group

base64_encoded.description: If true, the value of `file` must be base64 encoded

client.description: Clients with permissions on the group

accountcount.description: The amount of accounts on the provisioned system

externaluuid.description: The external uuid of the provisioned system

id.description: The value of the ID field of the provisioned system

name.description: The name of the provisioned system

technicaladministrator.description: The UUID and Name of the group that is set as the technical administrator

type.description: The type of the provisioned system

usernameprefix.description: The username prefix of the provisioned system

uuid.description: The UUID of the of the provisioned system

base64_encoded.description: If true, the content of `file` will be base64 encoded
